resources.string: ECU tuning and diagnostics for MS42 and MS43 engine control units.
How far before Top Dead Center (BTDC) the spark is fired. Advancing the timing gives the air–fuel charge more time to burn, which can increase torque and power—too much advance, however, risks knock.

The ratio of air to fuel (rich vs. lean). A richer mixture (more fuel) cools combustion and can boost low-end torque at the cost of higher consumption & emissions. A leaner mixture (less fuel) improves economy and lowers emissions but runs hotter and can cause knock.
Unburned mixture is dumped into the exhaust and ignites there, creating the characteristic “pop & bang” sound. Works on both MS42 and MS43 ECUs.
Cuts spark at a user-defined rpm offset before the stock fuel-cut limiter engages, creating a crisper soft rev limit. MS42-format tables only.
Same as the MS42 ignition-cut feature, but patched into the MS43 table layout. Use on MS43 ECUs only.
Holds engine rpm and mixture at a preset level to build boost for a consistent, hard launch. Works on both MS42 and MS43 platforms.
Keeps spark and ignition active during upshifts so boost is maintained—even while you’re shifting gears. Compatible with both MS42 and MS43.
Injects a minimal amount of fuel and retards timing when you lift off throttle, to keep the turbo spooled during roll-on acceleration. Primarily MS43-optimized but can be applied to MS42.
